thread.title: 13 Valentine’s Day dogs that would probably make better dates than humans
thread.title_full: 13 Valentine’s Day dogs that would probably make better dates than humans

author: Kenya Foy
title: 13 Valentine’s Day dogs that would probably make better dates than humans
text:
13 Valentine’s Day dogs that would probably make better dates than humans If the humans you know have a history of dropping the ball in the romance department, perhaps it’s time for a drastic new approach. So, um, have you considered asking a dog to be your Valentine’s Day date ?
We know it sounds weird, but don’t knock it ’til you’ve tried it. Ultimately, you’re in charge of your own happiness, and sometimes that means getting a little creative. If you’re looking to have an unconventional and awesome Valentine’s Day date , courting a canine might be the best way to go. C’mon, many bright ideas were born from a struggle. (Why do you think Galentine’s Day exists? Helloooo. )
Some naysayers may consider spending the day with an animal as peak desperation, but whatevs. We’re convinced any of these dogs would make better V-Day (or G-Day) dates than humans.
Why YES, we will certainly accept your rose, doggie. A photo posted by GoGetMe. (@go.get.me) on Feb 13, 2017 at 12:33pm PST 
This doggie date is cute and in the mood for smooching. A photo posted by Lilly The Pit Bull (@lillythepitbull) on Feb 14, 2016 at 3:57pm PST 
Cards and stuffed animals? Total charmers, these two. A photo posted by Jason & Vera Smith-Lane (@jasonverachihuahua) on Feb 14, 2016 at 4:20am PST 
Only dogs get away with tongue-wagging on the first date. A photo posted by @fancytheyorkie on Feb 13, 2016 at 11:31am PST 
New to dating outside your species? SAME, doggie. A photo posted by Jen & Jessie & JACK! (@jen_jessie_jack) on Feb 13, 2017 at 1:05pm PST 
It might not look like it, but trust us — this cat gets it. A photo posted by @banchinette on Feb 14, 2015 at 11:04pm PST 
Dog and bone are a package date deal. A photo posted by Greg Farrand (@farrand24) on Feb 13, 2017 at 11:15am PST 
Bring a friend and join this bowtie-wearing pair for dinner. A photo posted by Mrs Nibbles Doggie Designs (@mrs_nibbles_doggie_designs) on Feb 3, 2017 at 7:18am PST 
Because being dateless on Valentine’s Day can get stressful. A photo posted by Ashley Ringer (@aringer02) on Feb 14, 2016 at 8:25am PST 
This dog knows how to treat a date, and we love it. A photo posted by Life of Lucy and Norman (@lucyandnorman) on Feb 13, 2017 at 1:06pm PST 
A romantic stroll on the beach with a cutie = WIN WIN. A photo posted by Frankie the Labradoodle (@frankiethelabradoodle) on Feb 13, 2017 at 3:16am PST 
This adorable pooch definitely kisses on the first date. A photo posted by @projecthal on Feb 13, 2017 at 6:57am PST 
Aw! This charming bulldog cooks for the one she loves. A photo posted by Pud The British Bulldog (@misssquishyface) on Feb 13, 2017 at 12:53pm PST 
GAH! So many wonderful options, so little time to choose. Whatever happens, we’re sure your doggie date won’t disappoint.
